curam.util.orgtree.impl
Class OrgTreeLoader

java.lang.Object
  curam.util.orgtree.impl.OrgTreeLoader

public abstract class OrgTreeLoader
extends java.lang.Object

This is the superclass of any class which outputs the requested fragment for the lazy loading tree. Any descendants should just implement constructFragment method to output the tree fragment which is then returned and inserted into the tree widget rendered on the client side. The fragment is always started by creating the root item specifically with the createRootItem method; the rest of the items are constructed and added to their parent items the usual way. The rendered fragment is returned by the getResult method. This, however, is done under the hood and the constructFragment method of the custom loader should not be invoking it, rather just concentrating on creating the required items, setting their appropriate parameters and setting the correct parent - child relationships between them. The loader developer can choose to add all the child items immediately after their parent-to-be is constructed, or set the parent to be "lazy-loaded", which means that the children of that item will be obtained on demand via a separate request and from a different loader, taking this parent item as the root item (constructed again via createRootItem of that separate loader). The item is marked to be lazy loaded with the setLazyLoad method of the OrgTreeItem; the method is supplied with the fully qualified class name of the loader to be used. The current implementation of this class uses the default tree item implementation, OrgTreeJsonItem, which could not be overridden at this stage.

See Also:
OrgTreeItem, OrgTreeJsonItem

Constructor Detail

OrgTreeLoader

public OrgTreeLoader()
Method Detail

load

public void load()
          throws AppException
Constructs the tree fragment by invoking the custom method, implemented by the derived classes. This method should only be called directly during testing.

Throws:
AppException - if the tree fragment construction fails at some stage.

createRootItem

public OrgTreeItem createRootItem(java.lang.String itemId,
                                  java.lang.String itemLabel,
                                  java.lang.String itemType)
Creates the root item of the current tree fragment to which all the other items should be added. This could also be the root item of the whole tree itself (the first fragment root item).

Parameters:
itemId - identifier of the fragment root item to be created.
itemLabel - the visible text for the fragment root item.
itemType - the type of the root item being created.
Returns:
OrgTreeItem object for the created root tree item.

construct

protected abstract void construct()
                           throws AppException
This method must be implemented by all lazy tree loader implementations. It is responsible for constructing the tree fragment starting with the root item of the current fragment. The loaders are invoked for both the initial loads of the tree fragments and when updating them after the potential node addition/deletion/editing. A care should be taken to cater for the situation, where the requested root item is not available any longer (has been just deleted). In this case the construct method should just explicitly return to allow the tree widget be sent the right information.

Throws:
AppException - If the tree fragment construction fails.
